data.title: Cannot install Atom on win7
data.body:
I tried installing Atom using the handy installer (1.3.2.0) but it stops dead in its tracks on my Windows 7 box.

It exits with the "Installation has failed" message.

I've looked around on these "forums" a bit, and I can tell you that:
- My AntiVirus is Microsoft Security Essentials, with disabled real-time protection
- I have full administrator rights on this machine
- I did not previously try to install Atom 

I will install it manually, but I think the devs need to fix this urgently as most people will not have the patience necessary to do that :)

Here is my Setup Log. I "censored" my User directory for security reasons:

data.title: File(s) opens in wrong window
data.body:
When having two atom windows open, one with a project and one without. If you want to open a file that belongs to the project opened in window 1, and opens the file in window 2, it will be opened in window 1 instead.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Open a project / folder, refered to as window 1
2. Open another atom window, refered to as window 2
3. Open a file in window 2 that belongs to the project / folder opened in window 1

**Expected behavior:**

When opening a file from a window, it is expected that the file will open in the window you try to open it in.

**Observed behavior:**

When opening a file from window 2, the file was added to the view of window 1.
This happens both when drag-and-dropping* and using the open file dialog 

\* from the explorer window. I can drag-and-drop from a atom window to another when dragging from tab to tab  
**Atom version:** 1.3.2
**OS and version:** Window 7 Enterprise 64-bit

**Installed packages:**
atom-pair@2.0.10
merge-conflicts@1.3.7
minimap@4.19.0
minimap-git-diff@4.1.8
script@3.3.0
Sublime-Style-Column-Selection@1.3.0

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Unknown
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes

data.title: Ignore errors when loading an invalid blob store
data.body:
Fixes #10047.
Fixes #10015.

Although I am not able to reproduce the problem reported in the above issues, with this PR we're introducing a more flexible way of loading the blob store, which now doesn't crash Atom if any of the files is corrupted.

This seems like a reasonable default to have and, in the meantime, we can keep an eye on what triggers this particular edge case. I don't think it's a race condition caused by Atom, as we're already using a lock file to prevent such scenarios, but I could be overlooking something here.

/cc: @maxbrunsfeld @nathansobo @atom/feedback

data.title: Package update release notes information
data.body:
Hi!

I would like to propose a new _feature_ regarding a package update process:
Currently when an package update is available Atom does not show what exactly changed, I have plenty of packages installed and no one provides a clear changelog that you can see in the 'Available Updates' page.

It would be great to display the release notes of the packages when you click the package name in the 'Available Updates' page. I guess we need to introduce to the community an official way to do it.

Thanks!

data.title: Stop using atom-space-pen-views in all bundled packages
data.body:
Let's use a new select-list component that's based on etch: https://github.com/atom/select-list-component.

/cc @kuychaco

data.title: Fix measurement of rows that are present in the model but haven't been rendered yet
data.body:
Fixes #10051

This PR moves clipping of measured positions up to the editor and out of `LinesYardstick`. This allows us to check for the presence of a row in the editor after clipping is applied and saves complexity since `LinesYardstick` is only used internally and we can always control whether we clip the position we pass in.

Instead of just checking whether a row is visible in the model, we also check whether a DOM node with the line's assigned id is present. If It isn't, we force a synchronous render.

data.title: Smooth scrolling
data.body:
Is there any way to add this feature manually? I've searched packages but haven't found anything...

I want to have smooth scrolling like the one in sublime text.

data.title: Atom crash when closing fullscreen window on mac
data.body: When i use Atom and there is 2 windows in fullscreen (in 2 different desktop), when i close 1 of the windows Atom crash and all the windows are destroyed

data.title: editor hangs for very long time with 7.5k file
data.body:
I've found similar reports when using Atom with large files but my file is less than 300 lines with less than 150 characters each.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Download and open the file https://github.com/go-gcfg/gcfg/blob/083575c3955c85df16fe9590cceab64d03f5eb6e/set.go#L242
2. Go to the end of line 242 (btw I find it weird that in Windows the last character is not displayed in full so the cursor at the end is also not visible)
3. Press Enter

**Expected behavior:**

New line is started at L243

**Observed behavior:**

Atom editor window hangs for a very long time. (I thought it was indefinite but it came back after an hour or so.) After that, new line is started.

**Screenshots and GIFs**

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/450945/12091952/91203fdc-b33d-11e5-8a6f-8a288456d23a.png)

**Atom version:** 1.3.1 and 1.4.0beta3
**OS and version:** Win8.1 64bit, Debian8.2 64bit

**Installed packages:**

Just the core packages.

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: don't know
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: No

data.title: Atom crashes when files being accessed on a network drive go offline.
data.body:
I have a server which I host my own site own, I usually edit files on the server instead of making the files on a local machine and then transfer them over, this method also allows me to preview fonts that I use on my server instead of having to install them on the local machine. I have mapped the drive of the server to Windows so that I can easily access the files stored on there which makes editing files a lot easier on there.

A breakdown of that I what I did to create this crash -

1)Opening a file on an network drive via the File -> Open File.
2)Editing and saving the file on the server using Ctrl+S.
3)Shutting the server down using Git Bash while having the file still open Atom.
4)Atom crashes but gives you the option of:
-Closing the window 
-Reloading
-Keeping it open

I would have expected Atom to close the tab/file that was being edited on the network drive as closing the tab manually and then shutting the server down does not cause Atom to crash.

GIF of observed behaviour

![atomcrash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16539773/12091557/bb099300-b2ef-11e5-9484-29347d370ec5.gif)

That file open in Atom is a file I have stored on my server.

Atom Version - 1.3.2
OS - Windows 8.1

Installed packages -
color-picker
minimap

Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes, as it's editing a file on the network drive.

Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: I'd assume so, this is the only version of Atom I have used.

Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes, as it's editing a file on the network drive.

Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Happens with files and projects on the network drive, not local drive files/projects.

data.title: Repeated Ctrl +w also closes atom application when no more files are left open in the editor
data.body:
In Atom 1.4 beta 3 , Ctrl + w on linux/ubuntu closes the open file in the editor window,  but if you have a few files open and you are a heavy user of  ctrl+w to close them ,repeated ctrl+w also closes the application. 

This was not the behavior in the 1.3 , would be nice if the previous behavior is restored with changes in to the default key-mapping.

data.title: Convert fuzzy matching to a service
data.body: Fuzzy matching, like sorting the tree-view, is going to be a very opinion-based experience. We should create an `atom.fuzzy-matching` service that would allow anyone to create their own fuzzy matcher or fuzzy matcher package to customize the experience exactly how they want.

data.title: Keybindings are not selecting.
data.body: > I tried to search to see if there was a core package related to keybindings but _low and behold_ Github's repo search box is broken. Technology not on my side today. Well, here are two scenarios where keybindings have been messed up. First one was when I was attempting to set up custom keybindings for a package I was developing. I tried the same selector format as other plugins, to no avail. Keybinding-Resolver was showing it was there. The element was even focused. Nothing. Atom didn't seem to care. The second scenario, now prompting this issue, is when an upgrade failed for `ex-mode` (vim) and things started acting weird, I decided to re-install both `vim-mode` and `ex-mode` (hilarious they are two separate packages, by the way). Certain keybinds work. Others don't. For instance, `ci"` and `gg` do not work, but `G` does. Once again, keybind-resolver is showing correct bindings, but the selector system doesn't seem to think the current pane is worthy of having them trigger. The selection system is dreadfully picky, and now I'm left with a half-broken Vim setup forcing me to go back to _ye olde vim_ until this is fixed. I have absolutely no idea how to go about fixing this because it's all incredibly ambiguous. The keybinding system is random at best. And nope, no other packages are fighting for these bindings (I don't have very much installed). No errors in the console. Keybindings configuration is clean. Nothing in my init script. This is a pure example of the keybindings system being way too selective. For instance, here is me trying to do `gg` after the re-install. First `g`: and then on the second `g`:

data.title: Inserting a lot for p a, b in a Ruby file
data.body:
To reproduce:

In command line

```
$ atom try.rb 
```

now type in

```
a = 1
b = 2
p a, b
```

and it will show a list of suggestions.  I ignore the suggestions and just press Enter, and the line will become

```
p a, before_action :method, :only => [:action, :action], :except => [:action, :action]
```

wouldn't it make more sense if the "default action" is "(empty)"...
but I think in some situation, if I had a variable above "bestNumberFound", then pressing Enter and able to get the variable into my code is good... without the user needing to press the down arrow to "select it" first...

so I don't know... it seems like a trade-off.

Maybe you can have a 1st grade suggestions, which are what the users actually defined, and secondary suggestion, which are some library and framework variable or method names.

data.title: Sometimes the Whole Atom Got Frozen
data.body:
If a certain condition is met, every time the whole Atom will be frozen and have to be closed and restarted. I don't know if this bug lies in the core or in the `tree-view`.

Steps to reproduce:

First, create 2 directories with 3 subdirectories:

``` bash
mkdir lib
mkdir lib/c-v0.1.0
mkdir lib/c-v0.2.0
mkdir test
mkdir test/c-v0.1.0
```

Then, in each subdirectory place an empty file `main.js`:

``` bash
touch lib/c-v0.1.0/main.js
touch lib/c-v0.2.0/main.js
touch test/c-v0.1.0/main.js
```

Then type `atom .` to open Atom. Then click these 3 files to open them. When the third file is clicked, the whole Atom will be frozen.

This bug exists in v1.3.2. I haven't tested beta versions.
